title: `unconditional_recursion` lint doesn't work with struct update syntax

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a regression report! 🐛 A regression is something that changed between versions of Rust but was not supposed to.

Please provide a short summary of the regression, along with any information you feel is relevant to replicate it.
-->

### Code

I tried this code which causes a stack overflow due to a recursive call of `Default::default()` I mistakenly added.

```rust
struct S {
    x: i32,
    y: i32,
}

fn f() -> i32 {
    42
}

impl Default for S {
    fn default() -> S {
        S {
            x: f(),
            ..Default::default() // cause stack overflow
        }
    }
}

fn main() {
    let _ = S::default();
}

```

I expected to see the `unconditional_recursion` warning. However, the compiler didn't complain it.

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: **1.43.0** showed the warning. (ref. [the compiler explorer](https://rust.godbolt.org/z/s9qnGP))

### Version with regression

The warning isn't shown on **1.44.0** or later, including the current stable 1.47.0.


<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

<!--
Did the compiler crash? If so, please provide a backtrace.
-->

If you know when this regression occurred, please add a line like below, replacing `{channel}` with one of stable, beta, or nightly.

@rustbot modify labels: +regression-from-stable-to-{channel} -regression-untriaged
-->
